alert.note: Alert for Indiana; Jefferson (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 7:02AM EST until January 14 at 7:15AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northeastern Indiana County in west central Pennsylvania... Southeastern Jefferson County in west central Pennsylvania... * Until 715 AM EST. * At 702 AM EST, a hazardous snow squall was located along a line extending from Rockton to 10 miles northeast of Indiana, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. Locations impacted include... Clymer, Sykesville, Big Run, Rossiter, Ernest, Marion Center, Cherry Tree, Glen Campbell, Dixonville, Commodore, and Rochester Mills. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
